name: Tín Vietnamese Cuisine
amenitiesAndMore: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

Photo of Tín Vietnamese Cuisine - San Francisco, CA, United States. Vegetarian Pho (with fresh tofu)
Photo of Tín Vietnamese Cuisine - San Francisco, CA, United States. tin rolls
Photo of Tín Vietnamese Cuisine - San Francisco, CA, United States. Bun Cha Bun Bo Hue

reviews.text:
I've found my new favorite banh mi in SF! Tried the lemongrass tofu today. It's on the pricier side for a banh mi but it's quite filling and ingredients are high quality. The shiitake and onion stir fry, pickled veggies, marinated tofu hit the spot. It was toasted and the bread was the perfect crunchy texture. Service is friendly and fast here.

We always order their hue rolls, with steamed rice paper and marinated pork appetizer. We haven't found something like this at other Vietnamese restaurants we've tried in SF. My wife didn't love the pho the most recent time she had it here. She said the noodles were over cooked. We do enjoy their vermicelli bowls, which have been consistently good.

This is probably the best Vietnamese restaurant in SF. Every menu item is perfectly made and it really feels like home style cooking. 

I always start off with the Tin's Roll. What I super appreciate is that the server provided us with their house made lemongrass hot paste which was such an incredible addition. 

I love the combination of textures in the tin roll that packs pork, egg, a cruler, and veggies

I tried the Bun Bo Hue and loved it. While I normally prefer pho noodles, these thicker round noodles paired with the soup broth and meat which was cooked so well, it is such a heat combo for a cold day! 

Price: $$
Overall: 9.5/10
Must get: pho, bun Bo Hue, clay pot catfish, tin's roll

Tin is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF. I've tried a lot of their menu, and feel this is a restaurant where you can't go wrong no matter what you order. With that said, here are some of my favorites that I always re-order:

Cha Ca La Vong: Fried fish with dill and vegetables - perfect.
Mushroom bowl (add grilled shrimp): Huge portion, comes with bun (rice noodles) and fish sauce
Any of their salads (lotus, banana blossom, papaya) - cannot go wrong, plus they're light and healthy

This is a neighborhood favorite and it's easy to see why. Even going on a Thursday, the restaurant was packed full and plenty of delivery drivers were picking up food. While a bit crowded, the wait staff was working hard to take orders, bus tables, and bring food. 

We ordered the Bo Kho and Pho Bo. While i'd never say anything is close to homemade vietnamese food, the flavor profile and extra garnishes were perfect for a cold rainy SF day. Don't forget to ask for the garnishes! They are free upon request and a delicious addition. The Bo kho looked small but was plenty filling and full of soft beef and the pho bo had perfectly textured noodles and meat. I would recommend a visit!

Alright this place is my go to on DoorDash & I can only imagine how good the food is in person. I always get two meals from here because both items are SO good and ya girl can never decide. I ordered the phở bò ($14.5) - their broth is *chef's kiss*. It comes with all the fix-ins too: bean sprouts, juicy limes, sliced jalapeños, Thai basil, sriracha, & hoisin. So that's meal #1. Meal #2... is the bun noodle bowl!!!! OMG sooooooo good. I get the grilled marinated ribeye ($16.5) & y'all it's a MUST here. Vermicelli noodles with marinated ribeye, pickled veggies, & the Nước chấm drizzled on top! They never miss!

Not knowing what to eat at lunch time, past by this place and said why not with a few coworkers, glad we stopped by and sampled everything on their menu. Walking by we thought sure I can do pho or a sandwich, walked in and saw the Michelin rating on the door posted, first thoughts was Michelin rating for pho or vietnamese sandwiches?? Then taking a look a the menu and saw why this place had a Michelin star, several options on the menu, more then 10 items. For starters, soups, dry noodles, rice plates,

Sadly sat on this review for too long, I do recall everything we had was delicious and well worth the money, not your normal Vietnamese sando or pho spot, I would come back and sample everything again

Food ****
Price $$
Service ***** helpful staff
Ambiance ***** modern

It has been so long since the last time that I was here I didn't recall ever having the Pho Ga. The broth had a strong ginger flavor which I really liked. I still think the chicken pieces are over cooked. Regardless, I really enjoyed it and rank it higher than the other popular bowl of chicken pho in town. I would recommend trying the Tin Roll if you want something different. I think they invented it - boiled egg, pork, and a crispy center rolled in rice paper.

While I personally can't speak to the authenticity of Tín, my Vietnamese friend was pleasantly surprised by how authentic, and good the food was here. The dishes were delicious, authentic, and packed with flavor.

The pho, in particular the Bun Bo Hue, was amazing, with a broth that was rich and flavorful, and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The beef was tender and well-seasoned, and the bowl was filled with fresh herbs and vegetables that added an extra layer of flavor and texture.

The Banh Xeo is also an absolute must-try! This traditional Vietnamese dish is a crispy, savory pancake filled with bean sprouts, pork, and shrimp, and is served with fresh herbs and lettuce leaves for wrapping. The combination of bean sprouts, pork, and shrimp creates a flavorful and savory mix that perfectly complements the crispy pancake. I've never heard it before but my Vietnamese friend suggested it as an authentic and delicious choice, and it's definitely a new favorite for me!

One of the best things is also how affordable it is. Despite the fact that it may not have the most glamorous or upscale atmosphere, the prices are incredibly reasonable and make it accessible, you can easily come back again and again, and try something new each time. The food is incredible and more than makes up for the lackluster atmosphere. In fact, it's almost refreshing to find a restaurant that prioritizes its food over appearances, especially when the food is this good.

The Vietnamese food is some of the best I've had, and it's clear that the staff take pride in using authentic ingredients and flavors. If you're looking for delicious and authentic Vietnamese food, this is definitely the place to go!

Unassuming little hole-in-the-wall establishment with a minimalistic but rustic interior. The staff were beyond busy during lunch hour on a Friday, we stood at the entrance for a good 7 minutes before anyone had time to check in with us. 

Portions are large and filling, a vermicelli bowl would be good for one very hungry customer, one meal for-now one meal to-go, or two decently hungry customers. 

Lemongrass Pork Vermicelli Bowl (4/5):
- the huge portion i mentioned earlier
- lots of fresh veggies (bean sprouts and cucumbers)
- pork is flavorful with fragrances of lemongrass and caramelized sugars

Hue Rolls (5/5):
- i've never had rice noodle-esque wrapper for vietnamese rolls before but was pleasantly surprised by the texture (bouncy and chewy)
- perfect vegetable:wrapper:meat ratio (i didnt get a photo bc we ate kind if in a rush)
- veggies are fresh and the mint cools you down from the intensity of the lemongrass pork and fish sauce

We came here based on the recent reviews and I was a bit disappointed with the pho bo. There was something off with the taste of the noodles, it left some kind of aftertaste. I've had my fair share of vietnamese food in LA and never had that taste before. 
Other than that, the service was great and my wife enjoyed her food. There were a lot more people ordering take out than dining in. I might give this place another try next time.

name: Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant
amenitiesAndMore: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Private Lot Parking

Photo of Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant - San Francisco, CA, United States. Outdoor dining on a Saturday.
Photo of Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant - San Francisco, CA, United States. Buń bò huè
Photo of Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant - San Francisco, CA, United States. Bún bò Huế
Photo of Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant - San Francisco, CA, United States
Photo of Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant - San Francisco, CA, United States. Steak and Tendon Pho + pork Chops, Egg with Rice
Photo of Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant - San Francisco, CA, United States
Photo of Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant - San Francisco, CA, United States. Beef Combination Pho

reviews.text:
Quality Vietnamese food in the city for great portions and reasonable prices. 

We ate here after a night out of drinking and this really hit the spot. We ordered the shrimp spring rolls, a pho dac biet, and bun bo hue. I am pretty picky with my Vietnamese food since I come from a Viet background and living in San Jose for 6 years, however, I was pleasantly surprised with this place. 

The spring rolls were a little dry but came in huge portions so no complaints there. The pho dac biet was huge and had so much meat. I liked the broth, you can really taste all the herbs but it tasted clean as well. BBH was good too, it was the perfect amount of spicy and the flavors were authentic. 

Service was great as well, our friend had her handbag hung behind her chair and the server was nice enough to tap on us to make sure we had our bags in front of us since we were located in Chinatown and SF is notorious for robbers. 

Overall this was a very comforting meal and I liked how big the portions were.

A Vietnamese friend loves this place so came here with a group in Chinatown on a rainy day--it's her go-to Viet restaurant that's not in the Tenderloin.

Large, hearty portions at reasonable prices, you can count on being satisfied by this comfort food. It's a hole-in-the-wall, but locals love it.

Loved my Vietnamese coffee and bun bo hue, and friends enjoyed their pho. Great, flavorful broth.

No-frills Vietnamese eatery dishing out savory vietnamese noodle soups, imperial rolls, spring rolls and vermicelli noodle bowls to the local families of Chinatown and tourists looking for a good deal. 
Authentic flavors and big portions along with real Vietnamese coffee served out of a French press makes me love this place even more. 
Noted for authentic Vietnamese flavors, big portions and fair prices 
Family run so please tip kindly if you can!

The Thai tea really stole the show for me, definitely the freshest tasting I've ever had! The pho wasn't my favorite as I'm used to a much heartier broth, this broth was quite light, I had to doctor it up quite a bit to enjoy it.

This Vietnamese establishment is pretty popular with the locals. I've never seen it empty. Service has just been ok every time I've been here. During one of my previous encounters, they served me pho with bean sprouts already on top without an additional plate for the usual garnishes (bean sprouts, basil, etc.). Usually, there is a separate plate for customers to add :/.That being said, I can tell they are dedicated to serving their customers high quality food, making sure they enjoy and are satisfied with their food. I can also tell they have pretty dedicated loyal customers.

I usually order the: 
- Special House Beef Noodle Soup- They give good amount of beef in this, so it is definitely worth the price. Broth is really excellent-- fresh and flavorful. 

Overall, consistently great flavor. This is my second choice to visit when my usual Vietnamese restaurant is not open. It is a solid place for Vietnamese food.

I was in Chinatown but for some reason this place was on my mind over the years. This place is located in the alley way by the park and I was curious about it. Just my luck this place is good for getting Vietnamese food. The Pho soup was yummy and the pork chop plate was delicious. A good hidden gem in the alley of San Francisco's Chinatown.

Rainy day 
You need something to warm you up
Golden Star Vietnamese Pho is the place to go for its rich but clean after taste of beef broth. 
I like the original pho here, so #1 is my go-to dish here. My husband really liked his pork chop with imperial roll which is #35 on the menu. 

They take credit card which is also a great thing about the place! So many places nearby that only takes cash.

been coming here since i was a kid and it is still one of my favorite places for pho in San Francisco. It can be kind of hard to find since it is located in an alleyway next to the park. It is pretty hard to find parking here but there is a parking structure under the park. 

I always get the #1 house special beef noodle soup and it is delicious!! The broth is super flavorful and great meat to noodle ratio. Perfect for a rainy day!Their imperial rolls are amazing as well! Super crunchy and always hot when it comes. The lemon tea is pretty good too, but wish it was a little more flavorful. 

They were doing takeout only for a while because of Covid, but super glad they are open for dine-in now too. Service is pretty good, but prices have gone up since Covid. It is pretty small though, so you may have to wait a bit for a table during peak hours.

Vietnamese joint right in Chinatown. This place is pretty good. Their bun came with a lot of toppings and was a decent serving size. Not the best bun I've had, but it's decent. If you're craving Vietnamese food, it's a good place that will hit the spot.

Based on recommendations my friend and I stopped at the Golden Star for some authentic Vietnamese food. I ordered stir fried lemon grass chicken with vermicelli and it was great. I have nothing but praises for it, the noodles were cooked to perfection and the ratio of protein, to toppings, to noodles, to salad was on point. We also ordered some spring rolls, they were quite large so I would recommend splitting a smaller portion if ordering. I am no expert on Vietnamese food, but I found this delectable. 

The staff was super helpful, they educated us on how to eat the food properly, how to mix them, and what the sauces were used for. I really enjoyed this because it helped me appreciate the food as much as possible. I highly recommend going back to here, it was a great experience.

Photo of Miss SaiGon - San Francisco, CA, United States. 32. Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio with Goi Cuon Spring Roll

reviews.text:
I ordered through doordash. (I'm sorry, it's just late and I'm hungry). 
I ordered vermicelli bowl & spring rolls and it came really quick, service was really fast!  
I thanked the driver and I also want to thank the workers who took the time and made my delicious food. I was soo craving vermicelli (it's my favorite, soo fresh and tasty!) And thank you for dessert! (I love dessert)

I have been to several Vietnamese Restaurants all over San Francisco and also in Las Vegas... I have passed by Miss Saigon Vietnamese Restaurant many many many times while riding on the 14 Mission Bus... This was the one of the Vietnamese Restaurant that I have never thought that I would go and eat at Miss Saigon...

I came here for lunch after my CCSF Class...
And what I have ordered was A Thịt Gà Chiến Cơm Chicken Fried Rice I also requested a bud light... 

After When I Finished Up The Thịt Gà Chiến Cơm Chicken Fried Rice  My Thịt Gà Chi all I can say is that I tasted really Good!!! And Also The Nữ Phúc Vụ Waitress who took my order & served me was very friendly & helpful!!!!

If you Yelpers & Yelpettes like eating The Thịt Gà Chiến Cơm Chicken Fried Rice try going to Miss Saigon

Came by for lunch the other day and it was a disappointing experience. The restaurant merely had a couple tables occupied during a weekday lunch visit. SOMA is an interesting neighborhood with numerous challenged residents which makes walking in the area special.

The ambiance of the restaurant was dark with a record player playing music with a ton of static which was annoying at a minimum.

Started off with the bun bo hue and it was a disaster. The broth was warm and it appeared to be a standard beef pho broth with a spoon of hot sauce. The noodles were al dente and the thicker bun bo hue noodles. However, the meats were very dry and tough, a huge disappointment. There was a bed of vegetables that didn't look super fresh either.

The iced Vietnamese coffee was a touch watered down.

~$26/head after tax and gratuity for lunch.

Don't let the neighborhood outside fool you. Miss SaiGon offers a mean bowl of pho--my friend who grew up in Hanoi is a fan as well. 

It's family-owned and they also decorate around different holidays, making it fun to visit and see how they reuse and repurpose different decorations for different times of year. 

Would recommend the Butter Garlic Noodles, bun bo hue, and my Hanoi friend would always get #20, Pho Dac Biet (Beef Pho.) They also have Vietnamese desserts like Che Khoai Mon (taro pudding.)

Portions are large, broth is rich, and they include a lot of meat.

You can order online for pickup as well, or call in. Love the family that runs it!

I don't go out to soma too often and I felt like I needed to try this place. The service is very fast and very straight to the point.
The beef combination pho is very large and very worth if you're thinking about portion sizes. The broth has a lot of flavor and that carries over into the meat. The decor is very bright and lively. They give you tea and serve it in little teacups which I thought was extra cute.
Overall I would recommend coming here for Vietnamese food in the soma neighborhood.

This place is great for smaller and larger groups of people since they have ample seating indoors. Their menu is also pretty extensive and they serve a variety of options.

I ordered 17b small and it was so delicious! The broth was my favorite part since it wasn't too rich or light and I could taste the beef flavor. There's also a decent amount of beef in the dish. The portion sizes are pretty large and I had to take the rest to go.

The staff was also very kind to provide complimentary dessert for our friend since it was their birthday!

It is comforting to have a hot bowl of pho for dinner on a cold winter night! It really warms your body and soul up perfectly. It is one of my new favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the Bay Area, and i have eaten at quite a few Vietnamese places around San Jose and east bay 
I love that the soups come out piping hot! 
I had the chicken and glass noodle soup which was delicious! The other two bowls of pho Dac bite (special combination pho)  were very good too. 

To my surprise the Che 3 mau was very good too, it has thick creamy coconut milk and sticky rice, beans, and fruit. A little bit different from what most would expect but it was so rich and not overly sweet. 

Overall I would come back here to eat again soon.

Really recommend for a warm delicious meal! I got the chicken pho and spring rolls and it was just a really enjoyable time. Fast service and nice inside atmosphere. Recommend Parking at the mission impark by the mall 2 blocks away and walking over. Thank you for the food!

Really shocked by how many people say Miss SaiGon is their go to place for pho because I was not impressed at all. We did enjoy the steak and butter noodle dish though. I personally will avoid their pho items but would be willing to return and try a rice plate. 

I ordered their standard beef pho, which I think was #17. The broth was incredibly sweet! I was not impressed at all and didn't like that they added black pepper on top before bringing it to your table. I've never had this done before, the black pepper was not a nice addition. Like I said above, we did also order their steak and noodle dish, which I think was #47 and that was tasty. The beef was tender and well cooked 

The service was nice, which is why I can't give lower than 3 stars. I remember walking in and thinking the inside was very cute, you could tell they put effort into having Christmas decor. Cleaner than expected given the outside, it's very sketchy outside but inside is very homey. 

Their pho was just not my preference but I wish this family well for 2023 and their business, it isn't easy to survive in this location so it does speak to their customer base for keeping them alive

Overall:
Authentic
Super flavorful
Sketchy area, tho felt safe inside
Fast service
Generous portions
A must try for Vietnamese food in SF
Only giving this a 4 as I want to try other things on their menu before tossing out a 5!

Goi du du tom thit (4.5/5)
Delicious
Order this as an app - split with 2 other ppl
You'll thank me, as will your belly 

Bun thit nuong cha gio (5/5)
DELICIOUS
Really flavorful fish sauce 
The egg roll was like no other I've had 
Noodles were very thin - which is unique to here
Pork was well seasoned and thinly cut
Herbs and vegetables were fresh
Was really really happy with this order
And I think you would be too!

Bonus:
2 blocks away from Warfield - convenient location to try out prior to attending a concert there

Photo of Mau - San Francisco, CA, United States

Photo of Mau - San Francisco, CA, United States. Hue Rolls
Photo of Mau - San Francisco, CA, United States
Photo of Mau - San Francisco, CA, United States. Hue Rolls

reviews.text:
Great low key lunch spot. Tends to get busy around noon so either come early or be prepared to wait. There is indoor seating but it's limited. 

Their menu is basic but has all the goodies you want to be eating. From the Yelp photos before I think they used to serve noodle soups but now it's mainly banh mis, vermicelli bowls, and rice plates and no more noodle soups. 

I ordered the bun thit nuong with an added cha gio. Great serving size and very fresh. The noodles were springy and the veggies were plenty. The grilled pork was a little dry but the flavors were fantastic. Taste like something home made in my aunts kitchen. The cha gio is actually made from rice paper instead of egg roll paper and the filling was delicious. 

Pricing is more expensive than a traditional Vietnamese place but on par with the rest of the restaurants in downtown. I'd come back in a heartbeat. Support your local business and give this place a try!

Delicious food, friendly service staff, and a lovely modern venue. 

Tried their beef roll vermicelli salad, and loved it! Serving size was generous, with a good mix of veggies, noodles, and protein. 

The beef was nicely grilled and had good flavor. Staff were very attentive and friendly. Overall really enjoyed eating here!

Perfect quick lunch spot in edge of FiDi, this will be my new go-to spot for lunch! Unfortunately they don't have any soup noodle dishes, but I loved their noodle bowl! 

I got Bun Thit Nuong (grilled lemongrass pork) with vermicelli noodles, and was surprised to see how much meat they put in. For $17 (including tip) their portion is so good, especially in SF. The pork was juicy and a little charred, which I liked. Quick service and very welcoming, I'll have to come again to try their other dishes.

Love their banh mi!  Since out the door closed, it's been hard to get a good banh mi in this part of town. The sandwich is generously portioned!  Nice bread, good texture of refreshing pickles and overall great complementing flavors and textures in every bite!

People have raves about the pork shoulder and it is indeed yummy in both the rice roll and sandwich form. Love this new option in the neighborhood and will be back!

Do note that they're fairly busy during lunch so there can be a wait.

I am a fan!! I live around the area and have been looking for a solid Vietnamese restaurant. There really aren't many here. Well.... Enter in Mau. The lady who took our order was so pleasant. It's also a mom and pop shop which is SO rare in FiDi now after covid essentially wiped out all of them. I hope they're able to stay long term, but with the food tasting this good... it shouldn't be a problem!

Unfortunately I only speak to the chicken vermicelli bowl, but what a solid bowl. The chicken was so flavorful, juicy, and tender. A litttle bit on the fatty end, but I'd rather have that than lean and dry. They vermicelli and lettuce ratio was also on point. There are definitely some viet restaurants in the vicinity that give you the smallest vermicelli + heaping lettuce. All of the veggies tasted fresh. And lastly, they give you a cup of sauce which was the perfect amount as well (I tend to like saucy things.. so it's a *must* for me).

The restaurant itself is a no frills place... clean tables and chairs.. nothing too fancy and pretty standard. The one thing that was odd was that the recycling bin had a "out of order" sign and we couldn't recycle. Like.. what? 

Would totally come back to try their other foods. Come check out Mau if you work in the area!

The tastiest foods are the messiest right? 

MAU's banh mis are solid, and if you're working in FiDi this makes the PERFECT lunch. The only reason why this place is not a 5 star is cause the prices are INSANE. $14 on a banh mi, that's legitimately unheard of, especially for the authentic ones they're damn near always only half the price. Anything over $7-$8 (pushing it) usually just screams GENTRIFIED. Although this spot is $14 for a banh mi, I forgive them because gawd da*n those bad bois are delicious. Lemongrass pork is juicy and filled with flavor. The house spread is smothered all across the bread that is just the perfect baguette for banh mis truly. Their bread is definitely fresh as the outside is nice and crispy, but the inside is so soft. 

Just be prepared to ask for napkins. They only give you one, but you'll need more than that because the juice and sauces leak, and they really pack the sandwiches so everything is just constantly overflowing out after each bite. This spot HITS.

Tasty and reasonably priced. I ordered a vermicelli noodle bowl for lunch and was quite surprised to see how much meat there was inside. The lemongrass-chili chicken was well seasoned and the lettuce, bean sprouts, onion, pickled daikon, carrots, and peanuts went really well with the protein and noodles. Some pieces of chicken were tougher than others but overall it was a satisfying lunch and service was fast. Will return!

Banh mi!! Exactly the fix I was looking for! Got the lemongrass pork Bahn mi and it was perfect. You can really taste the lemon grass and it's nice and Smokey. I came here back to back. A lot of people come in and out for pickup. Service is pretty fast during lunch rush. 

If you tend to burp. You'll def taste this one, in a similar way after shrimp boil. Carry some mints!

A new lunch option in the neighborhood!

Was walking out of the the office for lunch today and needed to try something new. A couple of the guys (my colleagues) taking a cigarette break out there and suggested I try Mau. They are a Vietnamese restaurant and, to be honest, I am not sure how long they've been in this location, but after trying them for the first time, I am glad they are here!

I walked in and asked the gentleman behind the counter what he would recommend to a first-timer! After telling him that I was leaning towards a lunch plate (vs. sandwich or noodle bowl), he recommended the Grilled Lemongrass Pork or Chicken, so pork it was!

The thinly cut pork shoulder is spiced and grilled just right. The rice was perfectly cooked and the pickled daikon, carrots and cauliflower added that extra flavor to the whole thing!

I think they just got them a new "regular"! I will be going back!

Sadly they're only open for takeaway, so I'll have to hold off on getting a warm clay pot of caramelized fish.  But much of the rest of their menu translates to to-go very well.  I'm especially impressed by how tasty all the meats are.

Hue Rolls: So much better than the light shrimp rolls you get at many Vietnamese restaurants.  These are centered around thinly cut and heavily marinated grilled pork.  So much meaty smoky goodness in each bite.  The thick noodle-like wrap on the outside is also superior to this thin cellophane rice paper wraps typically used in rolls.  All the veggies and herbs between the meat and noodles perfectly offset the richness.

Bun Cha Ha Noi w/ Cha Gio: Meat overload!  The rice noodles, herbs and lettuce were in the bowl.  Thick grilled pork patties and thin marinated pork slices were in a container of tangy liquid on the side, with a few thin slices of carrots.  Definitely more meat than any bowl you'd get preassembled.  The pork slices were so full of flavor from their marinade to their grilling and finished with their soaking.  The grilled pork patties were extremely hearty and nicely spiced.  Also, liked the crispy cha gio add-on for even more pork indulgence, though quite filling with everything else.  Only gripe would be that it felt a little salty, since I was super thirsty the rest of the afternoon.

Xa Xiu Pork Banh Mi: Tons of crispy thick pork belly against all the expected trappings of a good Vietnamese sandwich.  The bread was chewy and crusty.  I like that the lightly pickled carrots and daikon were in thin discs rather than in in shredded form; gave it more texture.  Lots of yummy fresh cilantro and a generous amount of mayo.  There was also some sort of pork cold cuts, which added a good porky complement to the crispy pork belly.  My only advice would be eat this all at once.  I saved half for later and the pork belly lost its crispiness and the formerly crispy parts got rubbery.

Photo of Pho Tan Hoa - San Francisco, CA, United States. #26 Dry Pho

reviews.text:
Finally got a chance to come here after my friend declared this his "go-to" Vietnamese place in town.

I tried the Pho with rare steak and beefballs (#13) - huge portions with generous helpings of meat! Rare in this environment. 

I'm not enough of a pho connoisseur to tell you that this is the BEST beef pho I've ever had, but it was a pretty solid bowl of noodles.

Great, meaty pho at 9am in the morning! Best hangover soup!

I got the small Pho (perfect portion for a filling meal) and shared the spring rolls.

Ambiance is no frills but fast (less than 5 min) and welcoming.

I'm upgrading Pho Tan Hoa to my favorite pho restaurant in the TL. The other place on Larkin, TT went down hill. We had the #7 house special pho $16.50 large, #35 mi trieu chau (dry egg noodles) $14.50 medium and bo tai chanh (beef carpaccio) $18. Pho Tan Hoa is well worth the trek into the TL. The broth, meat, quality of the noodles, service are all excellent. 

Note, the weird people in the TL are worst now in 2022 than 2021. This was at noon on a Friday.

Pho Tan Hoa Ratings: 4.4/5

Food: 5/5 - I'm glad we are trying out a new Vietnamese restaurant each week in the Tenderloins and found Pho Tan Hoa this week. This place surprised me with their dry pho dish, and it hits the spot on every level, so interesting and unique! Please see the description of the entrees we got, because you definitely do not want to miss out on this one. 

- Dac Biet Pho Kho [GET]: I got their famous dry pho at Pho Tan Hoa, and rare to find at most Pho places in SF. It comes with well-done brisket, flank, tendon, and rare slice of steak. Love the roasted peanuts garnished on the top. They provide a bowl of soup and chili dipping sauce on the side, but I prefer the latter because it added some acidity, spicy and that tangy kick to the dish. The noodles are surprisingly flavorful and well-seasoned. I think it is seasoned in soy sauce, cooking wine, sesame oil etc., so delicious and not heavy at all. 

- Pho Xe Lua Tan Hoa [GET]: The classic house special beef noodle soup with well-done brisket, flank, tendon, and rare slice of steak was solid and the meat are tender. They give you an abundant amount of meat and noodles. The beef broth is hearty, but is a bit bland and I wish it had more of a stronger beefy flavor to it. The broth that comes with the dry pho was a lot more flavorful. The noodle is cooked just right, not too soggy or hard. My boyfriend think its a good pho, but not the best we've had. 

Ambiance: 4/5 - There are so many homeless people in the neighborhood, probably the worst location I've been to in the Tenderloins. The interior is very clean, bright, and simple though, bathroom is better than I expected, and I love how spacious it is. The chopsticks, spoons, and saucer were clean as well. Great place for a causal lunch if you live in the area, but they do close early since they are in a sketchy area. 

Price: 4.25/5 - The large beef noodle soup bowl and the dry pho was both $14.85 before tax (recently increased their prices). The total came up to be around $38 after tax and tips for the both of us. Portions are huge and generous, bigger the other Pho places nearby. Great value still, and they only take CASH but there's an ATM machine available if you don't. 

Service: 4.25/5 - Service is what you expect at an Asian restaurant. The staffs here are fast and efficient. Our server come to our table, took our order, and the food comes out within like 10 minutes. They come once to fill your water glass, but after that they will leave you alone, which is great. The lady was super nice and explained to me the in and out of that dry pho dish, so I was convinced. It was an great experience. 

BLUF: Another authentic Viet place in the Tenderloins. There's a ton of options on the menu, and I would suggest coming to Pho Tan Hoa for the Dry Pho, definitely something worth trying. The prices here are higher than other places, but it was still good. I would skip on the regular beef pho, unless you like broth on the blander / lighter side.

For when you need that bowl of hot soup on a rainy day (even for breakfast). The people who run this place are so down to earth. Great quick service, spending even 20 mins here slurping a bowl of noodles feels like an amazing reprieve from the world - and you leave with a belly full of warmth
I was planning on eating lunch here but it is a CASH only business. Writing review to let others know.
Solid pho place. Didn't disappoint. Recommend when you need a bowl of pho in the morning

Nice little pho place. It was perfect for I was so cold this am and wanted something warm to eat. The broth however was a bit sweeter than what I'm used to but the owners were very sweet and kind. 
I had a nice Thai tea which woke me up. I started with good summer rolls and then my beautiful warm pho came just in time. 
Clean, polite and I was full. So, I cannot complain. I just like my pho broth a bit saltier.

This is my fave pho in the city! Great portion sizes, most amazing broth, and fresh and delicious ingredients. I would go here every day if I could. I get the beef every time. The large is really large so be prepared. The regular or small (whichever they call it) is the perfect size if you don't want to have to take a nap after you eat.

Unexpected gem in the Tenderloin district. Had the combination beef bowl. The beef broth was delicious and full of flavor. It was perfect on a rainy day for lunch. Good food and service. I recommend eating here.
